data.name: uCpStartHs
description: R/W A control to set the position of the start of the HSync output signal in the CP core in Autographic
mode only. Programming of this parameter is optional and should only be performed when the part is set in
auto graphics mode. The value is unsigned.

data.name: uCpStartHs
description: R/W A control to set the position of the start of the HSync output signal in the CP core in Autographic
mode only. Programming of this parameter is optional and should only be performed when the part is set in
auto graphics mode. The value is unsigned.

data.name: uReserved7_5
description: No description

data.name: uCpEndHs
description: R/W A control to set the position of the end of the HSync output signal in the CP core in Autographic mode
only. Programming of this parameter is optional and should only be performed when the part is set in auto
graphics mode. The value is unsigned.

data.name: uCpEndHs
description: R/W A control to set the position of the end of the HSync output signal in the CP core in Autographic mode
only. Programming of this parameter is optional and should only be performed when the part is set in auto
graphics mode. The value is unsigned.

data.name: uReserved7_5
description: No description

data.name: uCpStartSav
description: R/W Manual value for Start of Active Video (SAV) position. Sets the total number of pixels between the
start of non active video and the start of active video. Programming of this parameter is optional and
should only be performed when the part is set in auto graphics mode. The value is unsigned. For more
information on auto-graphics mode, refer to the Hardware manual.

data.name: uCpStartSav
description: R/W Manual value for Start of Active Video (SAV) position. Sets the total number of pixels between the
start of non active video and the start of active video. Programming of this parameter is optional and
should only be performed when the part is set in auto graphics mode. The value is unsigned. For more
information on auto-graphics mode, refer to the Hardware manual.

data.name: uReserved7_5
description: No description

data.name: uCpStartEav
description: R/W Manual value for End of Active Video (EAV) position. Sets the total number of pixels between the end
of non active video and the end of active video. Programming of this parameter is optional and should only
be performed when the part is set in auto graphics mode. The value is unsigned. For more information on
auto-graphics mode, refer to the Hardware manual.

data.name: uCpStartEav
description: R/W Manual value for End of Active Video (EAV) position. Sets the total number of pixels between the end
of non active video and the end of active video. Programming of this parameter is optional and should only
be performed when the part is set in auto graphics mode. The value is unsigned. For more information on
auto-graphics mode, refer to the Hardware manual.

data.name: uCpStartVbiR
description: R/W Manual value for start of vbi position of the extra blank region preceding the odd R field in 3d TV
field alternative packing format through hdmi.Normally not required to program since this parameter is
calculated automatically from input.

data.name: uCpStartVbiR
description: R/W Manual value for start of vbi position of the extra blank region preceding the odd R field in 3d TV
field alternative packing format through hdmi.Normally not required to program since this parameter is
calculated automatically from input.

data.name: uCpEndVbiR
description: R/W Manual value for end of vbi position of the extra blank region preceding the odd R field in 3d TV
field a lternative packing format through hdmi.Normally not required to program since this parameter is
calculated automatically from input.

data.name: uCpEndVbiR
description: R/W Manual value for end of vbi position of the extra blank region preceding the odd R field in 3d TV
field a lternative packing format through hdmi.Normally not required to program since this parameter is
calculated automatically from input.

data.name: uCpStartVbiEvenR
description: R/W Manual value for start of vbi position of the extra blank region preceding the even R field in 3d TV
field alternative packing format through hdmi.Normally not required to program since this parameter is
calculated automatically from input.

data.name: uCpStartVbiEvenR
description: R/W Manual value for start of vbi position of the extra blank region preceding the even R field in 3d TV
field alternative packing format through hdmi.Normally not required to program since this parameter is
calculated automatically from input.

data.name: uCpEndVbiEvenR
description: R/W Manual value for end of vbi position of the extra blank region preceding the even R field in 3d TV
field a lternative packing format through hdmi.Normally not required to program since this parameter is
calculated automatically from input.

data.name: uCpEndVbiEvenR
description: R/W Manual value for end of vbi position of the extra blank region preceding the even R field in 3d TV
field a lternative packing format through hdmi.Normally not required to program since this parameter is
calculated automatically from input.

data.name: uDeVStartR
description: A control to vary the position of the start of the extra VBI region between L and R fieds during odd field
in field alternative packing in 3D TV video format.
This register stores a signed value represented in a 2's complement format. The unit of DE_V_END_EVEN[9:0]
is one pixel clock.

data.name: uDeVEndR
description: A control to vary the position of the end of the extra VBI region between L and R fieds during odd field
in field alternative packing in 3D TV video format.
This register stores a signed value represented in a 2's complement format. The unit of DE_V_END_EVEN[9:0]
is one pixel clock.

data.name: uDeVStartEvenR
description: A control to vary the position of the start of the extra VBI region between L and R fieds during even
field in  field alternative packing in 3D TV video format through HDMI.
This register stores a signed value represented in a 2's complement format. The unit of DE_V_END_EVEN[9:0]
is one pixel clock.

data.name: uDeVEndEvenR
description: A control to vary the position of the end of the extra VBI region between L and R fieds during even field
in field alternative packing in 3D TV video format through HDMI.
This register stores a signed value represented in a 2's complement format. The unit of DE_V_END_EVEN[9:0]
is one pixel clock.

data.name: uReserved7_6
description: No description

data.name: uBrNoiseShapingEn
description: R/W Enables a noise shaped truncation of the data from 12 bits to 10 bits or 8 bits (as specified by
CP_PREC[1:0])

values.description: Disables noise shaped bit reduction. Simple rounding is used for bit reduction
Enables noise shaped bit width reduction.

data.name: uBrNoiseShapingMode
description: R/W Enables the addition of random noise to the output data.

values.description: Does not add random dither to noise.

data.name: uBrNoiseShapingGain
description: R/W Selects the gain of the noise added to the output data when RND_DITHER_EN is set to 1.

data.name: uReserved1
description: No description

data.name: uTenToEightConv
description: A control to indicate if the precision of the data to be rounded and truncated to 8-bit has 10 bit
precision. This control is for HDMI use only.
channel. If the input data has got 10 bit precision - then the output data will have 10-bits per channel.
If the input data has got 8 bit precision - then the output data will have 8-bits per channel.

values.description: If the input data has got 12 bit precision
If The input data has got 10 bit precision, the output data will be 8 bits per channel.

data.name: uCpContrast
description: A control to set the contrast. This field is a unsigned value represented in a 1.7 binary format. The MSB
represents the integer part of the contrast value which is either 0 or 1. The seven LSBs represents the
fractional part of the contrast value. The fractional part has the range [0 to 0.99]. This control is
functional if VID_ADJ_EN is set to 1.

data.name: uCpSaturation
description: A control to set the saturation. This field is a unsigned value represented in a 1.7 binary format. The
MSB represents the integer part of the contrast value which is either 0 or 1. The seven LSBs represent the
fractional part of the saturation value. The fractional part has a [0 to 0.99] range. This control is
functional if VID_ADJ_EN is set to 1.

data.name: uCpBrightness
description: A control to set the brightness. This field is a signed value. The effective brightness value applied to
the Luma is obtained by multiplying the programmed value CP_BRIGHTNESS with a gain of 4. The brightness
applied to the Luma has a range of [-512 to 508]. This control is functional if VID_ADJ_EN is set to 1.

values.description: The offset applied to the Luma is 0 .
The offset applied to the Luma is 508d. This value corresponds to the brightness setting.
The offset applied to the Luma is -512d. This value corresponds to the darkest setting.

data.name: uCpHue
description: A control to set the hue. This register a represent an unsigned value which provides hue adjustment. The
effective hue applied to the Chroma is [(CP_HUE[7:0] * 180)/256 - 90]. The range of the effective hue
applied to the Chroma is [-90` to 90`]. This control is functional if VID_ADJ_EN is set to 1.

values.description: A hue of -90` is applied to the Chroma
A hue of 0` is applied to the Chroma
A hue of 90` is applied to the Chroma

data.name: uVidAdjEn
description: Video Adjustment Enable. This control selects whether or not the color controls feature is enabled. The
color controls feature is configured via the parameters CP_CONTRAST[7:0], CP_SATURATION[7:0],
CP_BRIGHTNESS[7:0] and CP_HUE[7:0]. The CP CSC must also be enabled for the color controls to be
effective.

data.name: uReserved6
description: No description

data.name: uCpUvAlignSel
description: Alignment of uv_data_valid internal signal generated by the CP core. The uv_data_valid signal is used to
map U and V pixels data into one single signal when the part is configured to output a 4:2:2 digital video
stream.

values.description: The uv_data_signal is synchronized with the Start of Active Video (SAV)
The uv_data_signal is synchronized with the leading edge of the HSync
uv_data_signal is synchronized with the leading edge of the DE
The uv_data_signal is synchronized with the Start of Active Video (SAV)

data.name: uCpUvDvalInv
description: This controls the polarity of the uv_data_valid signal generated by the CP. The uv_data_valid signal is
used to map U and V pixels data into one single signal when the part is configured to output a 4:2:2
digital video stream.

ALT_DATA_SAT.

data.name: uAltSatUv
description: Cr and Cb Saturation Range. Refer to ALT_SAT_UV_MAN for additional detail.

values.description: The range of the saturators on channels Cr and Cb is 15-to-235.
The range of the saturators on channels Cr and Cb is 16-to-240.

enabled

All three input channels have and embedded synchronization

description: No description

description: A control to select the mode the CP CSC operates in.

values.description: CP CSC configuration in manual mode
CP CSC configured in automatic mode

description: No description

values.description: High bandwidth, sharp transition filter for channels B/C
Soft filter with minimized ringing for channels B/C

description: No description

description: No description

data.name: uManCpCscEn
description: A control to manually enable the CP CSC. By default the CP CSC will be automatically enabled in the case
that either a color-space conversion or video-adjustments (Hue, Saturation, Contrast, Brightness) is
determined to be required due to other I2C settings. If MAN_CP_CSC_EN is set to one the CP CSC is forced
into the enabled state.
video-adjustments (Hue, Saturation, Contrast, Brightness) is determined to be required due to other I2C
settings.

values.description: CP CSC will be automatically enabled if required. For example if either a color-space conversion or
Manual override to force CP-CSC to be enabled

data.name: uReserved3
description: No description

data.name: uEia861Compliance
description: Control for compliance to 861B for 525p.This bit set the start of the VBI for the 525p standard only.

values.description: The VBI region starts on line 1.
The VBI region starts on line 523. The start of the VBI region is compliant with the 861 specification.

data.name: uReserved1_0
description: No description

data.name: uClmpAMan
description: Manual clamping enable for channel A.

values.description: Ignore internal digital fine clamp loop result. Use CLMP_A[11:0]
Use the digital fine clamp value determined by the on-chip clamp loop

data.name: uClmpBcMan
description: Manual clamping enable for channel B and C.
channel C.

values.description: Ignore internal digital fine clamp loop result. use CLMP_B[11:0] for channel B and CLMP_C[11:0] for
Use the digital fine clamp value determined by the on-chip clamp loop.

data.name: uClmpFreeze
description: Stops the digital fine clamp loops for channels A, B and C from updating.

values.description: Clamp value updated on every active video line.
Clamp loops are stopped and not updated.

data.name: uReserved4
description: No description

data.name: uClmpA
description: Manual clamp value for channel A. This field is an unsigned 12-bit value to be subtracted from the
incoming video signal. This value programmed in this register is effective if the CLMP_A_MAN is set to 1.
To change the CLMP_A[11:0], the register addresses 0x6C and 0x6D must be updated with the desired clamp
value written to in this order and with no other I2C access in between.

values.description: manual clamp value for channel A.

data.name: uClmpA
description: Manual clamp value for channel A. This field is an unsigned 12-bit value to be subtracted from the
incoming video signal. This value programmed in this register is effective if the CLMP_A_MAN is set to 1.
To change the CLMP_A[11:0], the register addresses 0x6C and 0x6D must be updated with the desired clamp
value written to in this order and with no other I2C access in between.

values.description: manual clamp value for channel A.

data.name: uClmpB
description: Manual clamp value for channel B. This field is an unsigned 12-bit value to be subtracted from the
incoming video signal. This value programmed in this register is effective if the CLMP_BC_MAN is set to 1.
To change the CLMP_B[11:0], the register addresses 0x6E and 0x6F must be updated with the desired clamp
value written to in this order and with no other I2C access in between.

data.name: uClmpB
description: Manual clamp value for channel B. This field is an unsigned 12-bit value to be subtracted from the
incoming video signal. This value programmed in this register is effective if the CLMP_BC_MAN is set to 1.
To change the CLMP_B[11:0], the register addresses 0x6E and 0x6F must be updated with the desired clamp
value written to in this order and with no other I2C access in between.

data.name: uClmpC
description: Manual clamp value for channel C. This field is an unsigned 12-bit value to be subtracted from the
incoming video signal. This value programmed in this register is effective if the CLMP_BC_MAN is set to 1.
To change the CLMP_C[11:0], the register addresses 0x6F and 0x70 must be updated with the desired clamp
value written to in this order and with no other I2C access in between.

data.name: uClmpC
description: Manual clamp value for channel C. This field is an unsigned 12-bit value to be subtracted from the
incoming video signal. This value programmed in this register is effective if the CLMP_BC_MAN is set to 1.
To change the CLMP_C[11:0], the register addresses 0x6F and 0x70 must be updated with the desired clamp
value written to in this order and with no other I2C access in between.

data.name: uAgcTar
description: R/W Manual AGC Target Value Enable. The register is used to set the target value for horizontal
synchronization depth after gain has been applied. The field represents an unsigned value. Manual AGC
Target Value. See also description of AGC_TAR_MAN, AGC_FREEZE, AGC_TIM.

data.name: uAgcTarMan
description: between the two.

values.description: The AGC operates based on a 300 mV or 286 mV horizontal synchronization depth. Use HS_NORM to select

data.name: uAgcFreeze
description: No description

values.description: The AGC loop is frozen and not updated further. the last gain value becomes static.

data.name: uHsNorm
description: No description

values.description: The AGC target scales the video as per 300 mV horizontal synchronization depth
The AGC target scales the video as per 286 mV horizontal synchronization depth

data.name: uAgcTim
description: R/W AGC Time Constant Selection.

data.name: uAgcTar
description: R/W Manual AGC Target Value Enable. The register is used to set the target value for horizontal
synchronization depth after gain has been applied. The field represents an unsigned value. Manual AGC
Target Value. See also description of AGC_TAR_MAN, AGC_FREEZE, AGC_TIM.

data.name: uGainMan
description: Enables the gain factor to be set by the AGC or manually.

values.description: AGC controls the gain for all three channels,
Manual gains are used for all three channels

data.name: uAgcModeMan
description: A control to set how the gains for all 3 channels is configured

values.description: The gain is dependant on the type of input and OP_656_RANGE

data.name: uAGain
description: A control to set the manual gain value for channel A.
This register is an unsigned value in a 2.8 binary format. To change A_GAIN[9:0], the register at
addresses 0x73 and 0x74 must be written to in this order with no I2C access in between.

data.name: uAGain
description: A control to set the manual gain value for channel A.
This register is an unsigned value in a 2.8 binary format. To change A_GAIN[9:0], the register at
addresses 0x73 and 0x74 must be written to in this order with no I2C access in between.

data.name: uBGain
description: A control to set the manual gain value for channel B.
This register stores an unsigned value in a 2.8 binary format. To change A_GAIN[9:0], the register at
addresses 0x74 and 0x75 must be written to in this order with no I2C access in between.

data.name: uBGain
description: A control to set the manual gain value for channel B.
This register stores an unsigned value in a 2.8 binary format. To change A_GAIN[9:0], the register at
addresses 0x74 and 0x75 must be written to in this order with no I2C access in between.

data.name: uCGain
description: A control to set the manual gain value for channel C.
This register stores an unsigned value in a 2.8 binary format. To change C_GAIN[9:0], the register at
addresses 0x75 and 0x76 must be written to in this order with no I2C access in between.

data.name: uCGain
description: A control to set the manual gain value for channel C.
This register stores an unsigned value in a 2.8 binary format. To change C_GAIN[9:0], the register at
addresses 0x75 and 0x76 must be written to in this order with no I2C access in between.

data.name: uCpPrec
description: A control to set the precision of the data output by the CP core for channels A, B and C.

values.description: Rounds and truncates data in channels A, B and C to 10-bit precision
Rounds and truncates data in channels A, B and C to 12-bit precision
Rounds and truncates data in channels A, B and C to 8 bit precision
Rounds and truncates data in channels A, B, and C to the precision set in OP_FORMAT_SEL[6:0]

data.name: uAOffset
description: A control to set the manual offset for channel A.
This field stores an unsigned value. To change A_OFFSET[9:0], the register addresses 0x77 and 0x78 must be
written to in this order with no I2C access in between.

data.name: uAOffset
description: A control to set the manual offset for channel A.
This field stores an unsigned value. To change A_OFFSET[9:0], the register addresses 0x77 and 0x78 must be
written to in this order with no I2C access in between.

data.name: uBOffset
description: A control to set the manual offset for channel B.
This field stores an unsigned value. To change B_OFFSET[9:0], the register addresses 0x78 and 0x79 must be
written to in this order with no I2C access in between.

data.name: uBOffset
description: A control to set the manual offset for channel B.
This field stores an unsigned value. To change B_OFFSET[9:0], the register addresses 0x78 and 0x79 must be
written to in this order with no I2C access in between.

data.name: uCOffset
description: A control to set the manual offset for channel C.
This field stores an unsigned value. To change C_OFFSET[9:0], the register addresses 0x79 and 0x7A must be
written to in this order with no I2C access in between.

data.name: uCOffset
description: A control to set the manual offset for channel C.
This field stores an unsigned value. To change C_OFFSET[9:0], the register addresses 0x79 and 0x7A must be
written to in this order with no I2C access in between.

data.name: uAvInvF
description: A control to invert the F bit in the AV codes.

values.description: Inserts the F bit with default polarity,
Inverts the F bit before inserting it into the AV code

data.name: uAvInvV
description: A control to invert V bit in AV codes.

values.description: Do not invert V bit polarity before inserting it into the AV code,
Invert V bit polarity before inserting it into the AV code

data.name: uReserved5_3
description: No description

data.name: uAvPosSel
description: A control to select AV codes position

values.description: SAV code at HS falling edge and EAV code at HS rising edge.
Uses predetermined (default) positions for AV codes.

data.name: uReserved1
description: No description

data.name: uDeWithAvcode
description: A control to insert AV codes in relation to the DE output signal

values.description: AV codes locked to default values. DE position can be moved independently of AV codes.
Inserted AV codes moves in relation to DE position change.

data.name: uCpInvHs
description: A control to set the polarity of the HSync output by the CP core. This control is not recommended for use.
INV_HS_POL in IO Map, Register 0x06 [1] should be used instead.

values.description: The CP outputs a HSync with negative polarity
The CP outputs a HSync with positive polarity

data.name: uCpInvVs
description: A control to set the polarity of the VSync output by the CP core. This control is not recommended for use.
INV_VS_POL in IO Map, Register 0x06 [2] should be used instead.

values.description: The CP outputs a VSync with negative polarity
The CP outputs a VSync with positive polarity

data.name: uReserved5
description: No description

data.name: uCpInvDe
description: A control to set the polarity of the FIELD/DE output by the CP core. This control is not recommended for
use. INV_F_POL in IO Map, Register 0x06 [3] should be used instead.

values.description: The CP outputs FIELD/DE with negative polarity
The CP outputs FIELD/DE with positive polarity

data.name: uStartHs
description: R/W A control to shift the position of the leading edge of the HSync output by the CP core. This register
stores a signed value in a 2's complement format. START_HS[9:0] is the number of pixel clocks by which the
leading edge of the HSync is shifted (e.g. 0x3FF corresponds to a shift of 1 pixel clock away form the
active video, 0x005 corresponds to a shift of 5 pixel clocks toward the active video).

values.description: The leading edge of the HSync is shifted toward the active video.
The leading edge of the HSync is shifted away from the active video.

data.name: uEndHs
description: A control to shift the position of the trailing edge of the HSync output by the CP core.
This register stores a signed value in a 2's complement format. HS_END[9:0] is the number of pixel clock
by which the leading edge of the HSync is shifted (e.g. 0x3FF corresponds to a shift of 1 pixel clock away
form the active video, 0x005 corresponds to a shift of 5 pixel clocks toward the active video).

values.description: The trailing edge of the HSync is shifted toward the active video.
The trailing edge of the HSync is shifted away from the active video.

data.name: uEndHs
description: A control to shift the position of the trailing edge of the HSync output by the CP core.
This register stores a signed value in a 2's complement format. HS_END[9:0] is the number of pixel clock
by which the leading edge of the HSync is shifted (e.g. 0x3FF corresponds to a shift of 1 pixel clock away
form the active video, 0x005 corresponds to a shift of 5 pixel clocks toward the active video).

values.description: The trailing edge of the HSync is shifted toward the active video.
The trailing edge of the HSync is shifted away from the active video.

data.name: uStartHs
description: R/W A control to shift the position of the leading edge of the HSync output by the CP core. This register
stores a signed value in a 2's complement format. START_HS[9:0] is the number of pixel clocks by which the
leading edge of the HSync is shifted (e.g. 0x3FF corresponds to a shift of 1 pixel clock away form the
active video, 0x005 corresponds to a shift of 5 pixel clocks toward the active video).

values.description: The leading edge of the HSync is shifted toward the active video.
The leading edge of the HSync is shifted away from the active video.

data.name: uStartVs
description: A control to shift the position of the leading edge of the VSync output by the CP core.
This register stores a signed value in a 2's complement format. START_VS[3:0] is the number of lines by
which the leading edge of the VSync is shifted (e.g. 0x0F corresponds to a shift by 1 line toward the
active video, 0x01 corresponds to a shift of 1 line away from the active video).

values.description: The leading edge of the VSync is shifted toward the active video.
The leading edge of the VSync is shifted away from the active video.

data.name: uEndVs
description: A control to shift the position of the trailing edge of the VSync output by the CP core.
This register stores a signed value in a 2's complement format. SEND_VS[3:0] is the number of lines by
which the trailing edge of the VSync is shifted (e.g. 0x0F corresponds to a shift of 1 line toward the
active video, 0x01 corresponds to a shift of 1 line away from the active video).

values.description: The trailing edge of the VSync is shifted toward the active video.
The trailing edge of the VSync is shifted away from the active video.

data.name: uStartFe
description: A control to shift the position of the start of even field edge of the FIELD signal output by the CP core
This register stores a signed value in a 2's complement format. START_FE[3:0] the number of lines by which
the start of the even fields edge of the FIELD signal is shifted (e.g. 0x0D corresponds to a shift of 3
lines toward the active video, 0x05 corresponds to a shift of 5 line away from the active video).
the active video.
from the active video.

values.description: The edge of the FIELD signal corresponding to the start of the even field is shifted toward
The trailing of the FIELD signal corresponding to the start of the even field is shifted away

data.name: uStartFo
description: A control to shift the position of the start of odd field edge of the FIELD signal output by the CP core
This register stores a signed value in a 2's complement format. START_FO[3:0] the number of lines by which
the start of the odd fields edge of the FIELD signal is shifted (e.g. 0x0D corresponds to a shift of 3
lines toward the active video, 0x05 corresponds to a shift of 5 line away from the active video).
the active video.
from the active video.

values.description: The edge of the FIELD signal corresponding to the start of the odd field is shifted toward
The trailing of the FIELD signal corresponding to the start of the odd field is shifted away

data.name: uCpGainFilt
description: A control to set the coefficient A of the IIF filter to filter the gain applied to the video signal when
the gain is manually set. The value set in this register is effective only when manual gain is enabled.
The filter is designed as and IIR filter with a transfer function of the form Y[N]=(1-A)*y[N-1]+A*X[N]

data.name: uReserved3_0
description: No description

data.name: uReserved7_3
description: No description

data.name: uCh1TrigStdi
description: Trigger synchronization source and polarity detector for sync channel 1 STDI. A 0 to 1 transition in this
bit restarts the auto-sync detection algorithm. This is not a self-clearing bit and must be set to 0 to
prepare for next trigger.

values.description: Transition 0 to 1 restarts auto-sync detection algorithm

data.name: uCh1StdiCont
description: A control to select the sync channel 1 STDI mode of operation

values.description: sync channel 1 STDI works in one-shot mode (triggered by a 0 to 1 transition on the CH1_TRIG_STDI bit)
sync channel 1 STDI works in continuous mode

data.name: uReserved0
description: No description

data.name: uDeVStartEven
description: A control to vary the start position of the VBI region in even field.
This register stores a signed value represented in a 2's complement format. The unit of
DE_V_START_EVEN[9:0] is one pixel clock.

data.name: uDeVEndEven
description: A control to vary the position of the end of the VBI region in even field.
This register stores a signed value represented in a 2's complement format. The unit of DE_V_END_EVEN[9:0]
is one pixel clock.

data.name: uStartVsEven

by which the leading edge of the Vsync is shifted (e.g. 0x0F corresponds to a shift by 1 line toward the
active video, 0x01 corresponds to a shift of 1 line away from the active video).

values.description: The leading edge of the even Vsync is shifted toward the active video.
The leading edge of the even Vsync is shifted away from the active video.

data.name: uEndVsEven
description: A control to shift the position of the trailing edge of the Vsync output by the CP core.
This register stores a signed value in a 2's complement format. SEND_VS_EVEN[3:0] is the number of lines
by which the trailing edge of the Vsync is shifted (e.g. 0x0F corresponds to a shift of 1 line toward the
active video, 0x01 corresponds to a shift of 1 line away from the active video).

values.description: The trailing edge of the even Vsync is shifted toward the active video.
The trailing edge of the even Vsync is shifted away from the active video.

data.name: uReserved7_4
description: No description

data.name: uDeHStart
description: R/W A control to vary the leading edge position of the DE signal output by the CP core. This register

description: A control to vary the trailing edge position of the DE signal output by the CP core.

data.name: uDeHEnd

data.name: uDeHStart

description: No description

data.name: uCh1FrLl
description: Free run line length in number of crystal clock cycles in one line of video for sync channel 1 STDI. This
register should only be programmed video standards that are not supported by PRIM_MODE[3:0] and
VID_STD[5:0].

values.description: Internal free run line length is decoded from PRIM_MODE[3:0] and VID_STD[5:0].
Number of crystal clocks in the ideal line length. Used to enter or exit free run mode.

data.name: uCh1FrLl
description: Free run line length in number of crystal clock cycles in one line of video for sync channel 1 STDI. This
register should only be programmed video standards that are not supported by PRIM_MODE[3:0] and
VID_STD[5:0].

values.description: Internal free run line length is decoded from PRIM_MODE[3:0] and VID_STD[5:0].
Number of crystal clocks in the ideal line length. Used to enter or exit free run mode.

data.name: uCh1Lcf
description: A readback for the sync channel 1 Line Count in a Field
Number of lines between two VSyncs measured on sync channel 1. The readback from this field is valid if
CH1_STDI_DVALID is high.

data.name: uCh1Lcf
description: A readback for the sync channel 1 Line Count in a Field
Number of lines between two VSyncs measured on sync channel 1. The readback from this field is valid if
CH1_STDI_DVALID is high.

data.name: uCpStartVbi
description: R/W Manual value for start of VBI region position (of odd fields in case of interlaced output). This is an
unsigned value. It set the total number of lines at the start of a frame of non-interlaced standard video.
It sets the total number of lines at the start of the odd frame of interlaced standard video. Programming
of this parameter is optional and should only be performed when the part is set in auto-graphics mode. For
information on auto graphics mode, refer to the Hardware Manual.

values.description: manual value for start of VBI region position

data.name: uCpStartVbi
description: R/W Manual value for start of VBI region position (of odd fields in case of interlaced output). This is an
unsigned value. It set the total number of lines at the start of a frame of non-interlaced standard video.
It sets the total number of lines at the start of the odd frame of interlaced standard video. Programming
of this parameter is optional and should only be performed when the part is set in auto-graphics mode. For
information on auto graphics mode, refer to the Hardware Manual.

values.description: manual value for start of VBI region position

data.name: uCpEndVbi
description: R/W Manual value for end of VBI region position (of odd fields in case of interlaced output). This is an
unsigned value. It sets the total number of lines at the end of a frame of non-interlaced standard video.
It sets the total number of lines at the end of the odd frame of interlaced standard video. Programming of
this parameter is optional and should only be performed when the part is set in auto-graphics mode. For
information on auto graphics mode, refer to the Hardware Manual.

values.description: manual value for end of VBI region position

data.name: uCpEndVbi
description: R/W Manual value for end of VBI region position (of odd fields in case of interlaced output). This is an
unsigned value. It sets the total number of lines at the end of a frame of non-interlaced standard video.
It sets the total number of lines at the end of the odd frame of interlaced standard video. Programming of
this parameter is optional and should only be performed when the part is set in auto-graphics mode. For
information on auto graphics mode, refer to the Hardware Manual.

values.description: manual value for end of VBI region position

data.name: uCpStartVbiEven
description: R/W Manual value for start of VBI in even fields. This is an unsigned value. Total number of lines at the
start of the even frame of interlaced standard. Programming of this parameter is optional and should only
be performed when the part is set in auto-graphics mode. For information on auto graphics mode, refer to
the Hardware Manual.

values.description: manual value for start of VBI in even fields.

data.name: uCpStartVbiEven
description: R/W Manual value for start of VBI in even fields. This is an unsigned value. Total number of lines at the
start of the even frame of interlaced standard. Programming of this parameter is optional and should only
be performed when the part is set in auto-graphics mode. For information on auto graphics mode, refer to
the Hardware Manual.

values.description: manual value for start of VBI in even fields.

of lines at the end of the even frame of interlaced standard. Programming of this parameter is optional
and should only be performed when the part is set in auto graphics mode. For information on auto graphics
mode, refer to the Hardware Manual.

values.description: manual value for end of VBI region position for even fields.

data.name: uCpEndVbiEven
description: R/W Manual value for end of VBI region position for even fields. This is an unsigned value. Total number
of lines at the end of the even frame of interlaced standard. Programming of this parameter is optional
and should only be performed when the part is set in auto graphics mode. For information on auto graphics
mode, refer to the Hardware Manual.

values.description: manual value for end of VBI region position for even fields.

data.name: uCpLcountMax
description: Manual value for total number of lines in a frame expected by the CP core. CP_LCOUNT_MAX[11:0] is an
unsigned value. This register is used for manual configuration of the free run feature. The value
programmed in this register is used for sync channel 1. The value programmed in this register is used also
for sync channel 2 if CH2_FR_FIELD_LENGTH[10:0] set to 0x000.

values.description: Ideal number of lines per frame is decoded from PRIM_MODE[3:0] and VID_STD[5:0] for sync channel 1.
Use the programmed value as ideal number of lines per frame in free run decision for sync channel

data.name: uCpLcountMax
description: Manual value for total number of lines in a frame expected by the CP core. CP_LCOUNT_MAX[11:0] is an
unsigned value. This register is used for manual configuration of the free run feature. The value
programmed in this register is used for sync channel 1. The value programmed in this register is used also
for sync channel 2 if CH2_FR_FIELD_LENGTH[10:0] set to 0x000.

values.description: Ideal number of lines per frame is decoded from PRIM_MODE[3:0] and VID_STD[5:0] for sync channel 1.
Use the programmed value as ideal number of lines per frame in free run decision for sync channel

data.name: uReserved3_0
description: No description

data.name: uCh1StdiDvalid
description: This bit is set when the measurements performed by sync channel 1 STDI are completed. High level signals
validity for CH1_BL, CH1_LCF, CH1_LCVS, CH1_FCL, and CH1_STDI_INTLCD parameters. To prevent false
readouts, especially during signal acquisition, CH1_SDTI_DVALID only goes high after four fields with same
length are recorded. As a result, STDI measurements can take up to five fields to finish.

values.description: Sync channel 1 STDI measurement are not valid
Sync channel 1 STDI measurement are valid

data.name: uCh1StdiIntlcd
description: Interlaced vs. progressive mode detected by sync channel 1 STDI. The readback from this register is valid
if CH1_STDI_DVALID is high.

values.description: Indicates a video signal on sync channel 1 with non interlaced timing.
Indicates a signal on sync channel 1 with interlaced timing.

data.name: uCh1Bl
description: A readback for the Block Length for sync channel 1. Number of crystal cycle cycles in a block of eight
lines of incoming video. This readback is valid if CH1_STDI_DVALID is high.

data.name: uCh1Bl
description: A readback for the Block Length for sync channel 1. Number of crystal cycle cycles in a block of eight
lines of incoming video. This readback is valid if CH1_STDI_DVALID is high.

data.name: uCh1Lcvs
description: A readback for the sync channel 1 Line Count in a VSync.
Number of lines in a VSync period measured on sync channel 1. The readback from this field is valid if
CH1_STDI_DVALID is high.

data.name: uReserved2_0
description: No description

data.name: uReserved7_5
description: No description

data.name: uCh1Fcl
description: A readback for the sync channel 1 Field Count Length
Number of crystal clock cycles between successive VSyncs measured by sync channel 1 STDI or in 1/256th of
a field. The readback from this field is valid if CH1_STDI_DVALID is high.

data.name: uCh1Fcl
description: A readback for the sync channel 1 Field Count Length
Number of crystal clock cycles between successive VSyncs measured by sync channel 1 STDI or in 1/256th of
a field. The readback from this field is valid if CH1_STDI_DVALID is high.

data.name: uReserved7_2
description: No description

data.name: uHdmiFrunMode
description: A control to configure the free run feature in HDMI mode.
port or it the video resolution of HDMI stream processed by the part does not match the video resolution
programmed in PRIM_MODE[3:0] and VID_STD[5:0].

values.description: HDMI free run mode 0. The part free runs when the TMDS clock is not detected on the selected HDMI port
HDMI free run mode 1. The CP core free runs when the TMDS clock is not detected on the selected HDMI

data.name: uHdmiFrunEn
description: A control to enable free run in HDMI mode.

values.description: Disable the free run feature in HDMI mode
Enable the free run feature in HDMI mode

description: No description

data.name: uDppBypassEn
description: Manual control to enable DPP block.

data.name: uReserved3_0
description: No description

Do not delay the data of channel A

data.name: uDlyB
description: A control to delay the data on channel B by one pixel clock cycle.

values.description: Delay the data of channel B by 1 pixel clock cycle
Do not delay the data of channel B

data.name: uDlyC

Do not delay the data of channel C

data.name: uReserved4_2
description: No description

data.name: uHcountAlignAdj
description: Manual adjustment for internally generated hcount offset . This register allows an adjustment of 15 pixels
to the left or to the right. The MSB sets the direction (left or right) and the 4 LSBs set the number of
pixels to move. This is an unsigned control.
xxxxx - manual adjustment for internally generated hcount offset.

data.name: uHcountAlignAdj
description: Manual adjustment for internally generated hcount offset . This register allows an adjustment of 15 pixels
to the left or to the right. The MSB sets the direction (left or right) and the 4 LSBs set the number of
pixels to move. This is an unsigned control.
xxxxx - manual adjustment for internally generated hcount offset.

data.name: uReserved4_3
description: No description

data.name: uCpDefColManVal
description: A control to enable manual selection of the color used when the CP core free runs.

values.description: Outputs default colors as given in CP_DEF_COL_CHA, CP_DEF_COL_B and CP_DEF_COL_C

data.name: uCpDefColAuto
description: A control to enable the insertion of default color when the CP free runs.

values.description: Disable automatic insertion of default color
Output default colors when the CP free runs

data.name: uCpForceFreerun
description: A control to force the CP to free run.

values.description: Do not force the CP core free run.
Force the CP core to free run.

data.name: uDefColCha
description: A control the set the default color for channel A. To be used if CP_DEF_COL_MAN_VAL is 1.

data.name: uDefColChb
description: A control to set the default color for channel B. To be used if CP_DEF_COL_MAN_VAL is 1

data.name: uDefColChc
description: A control to set the default color for channel C. To be used if CP_DEF_COL_MAN_VAL is 1

data.name: uReserved7_3
description: No description

Do not swap the Luma and Chroma AV codes in DDR mode

description: No description

data.name: uAutoSlFilterFreezeEn
description: R/W This bit determines if the internally generated parameter for the position of the HSync trailing edge
is updated during the VBI region. This control is only intended for auto-graphics mode. It is recommended
to leave AUTO_SL_FILTER_FREEZE_EN to default. Unless AUTO_SL_FILTER_FREEZE_EN is left to default, the part
may generat e an incorrect HSync trailing edge position parameter if the input synchronization is embedded
and has serration pulses

values.description: Do not freeze the trailing edge position of the HSync during the VBI region.
Freeze the trailing edge position of the HSync during the VBI region.

data.name: uReserved4_2
description: No description

data.name: uHdmiCpLockThreshold
description: Locking time of filter used for buffering of timing parameters in HDMI mode.

data.name: uReserved7
description: No description

data.name: uHdmiCpAutoparmLocked
description: A readback to report the lock status of the parameter buffering in HDMI mode

values.description: The parameter buffering block has not lock to the synchronization signal from the HDMI core.
The parameter buffering block has lock to the synchronization signal from the HDMI core.

data.name: uHdmiAutoparmSts
description: CP status for HDMI mode

values.description: The CP is free running with according to timing parameters programmed in PRIM_MODE and VID_STD
The timing buffer filter has locked to the HDMI input
The CP is free running according to the HDMI buffered parameters

data.name: uReserved3_2
description: No description

is in a 1.9 binary format and composed of one integer and nine fractional bits.

data.name: uCh1FRunThr
description: Free run threshold select for sync channel 1. Determines the horizontal conditions under which free run
mode is entered or left. The length of the incoming video line is measured based on the crystal clock and
compared to an internally stored parameter. The magnitude of the difference decides whether or not sync
channel 1 will enter free run mode.

values.description: Minimum difference to switch into free run is 2. Maximum difference to switch out of free run is 1.
Minimum difference to switch into free run is 256. Maximum difference to switch out of free run is 200.
Minimum difference to switch into free run is 128. Maximum difference to switch out of free run is 112.
